key_insight: AnyAD is a single unified model that detects anomalies from brain MRI even when one or more common sequences are missing — it generalizes to arbitrary combinations of modalities without retraining.
problem_solved: Overcomes the clinical reality of incomplete multi-sequence MRI and the limitation of prior AD models that require fixed modality configurations or repeated training for different modality sets.
method: Train a unified any-modality architecture that ingests any subset of MRI sequences and maps them to a shared latent space for anomaly scoring.
Simulate missing-modality conditions during training (modality dropout / conditional masking) so the model learns to fuse available inputs robustly and to impute or ignore absent channels.
Produce uncertainty-aware anomaly maps via reconstruction / distributional scoring in the shared latent space, enabling single-model deployment across unseen modality combinations.
impact: Enables practical, scalable deployment of MRI anomaly detection across heterogeneous clinical protocols, reducing the need for modality-specific models and repeated retraining while maintaining robust detection under missing data.
visual_elements: Schematic: inputs with varying MRI sequences (T1, T2, FLAIR, etc.) feeding a single AnyAD model and producing an anomaly map — demonstrates 'any-modality' flow.
Training diagram showing modality dropout / masking and shared latent space learning.
Performance chart: accuracy/ROC or anomaly-score robustness across many modality-combination scenarios comparing AnyAD vs fixed-config baselines.
Example overlays: MRI slices with ground-truth (if available) and AnyAD anomaly heatmaps to show localization quality.
paper_title: AnyAD: Unified Any-Modality Anomaly Detection in Incomplete Multi-Sequence MRI
paper_authors: Changwei Wu, Yifei Chen, Yuxin Du, Mingxuan Liu, Jinying Zong
